Existence of limits, one sided limits, and infinity limits.

One sided limits

When xxx approaches a point aaa from one side only:

  • Left-sided limit: lim⁡x→a−f(x)=L\lim_{x \to a^-} f(x) = Llimx→a−​f(x)=L
    • means xxx approaches aaa with x<a,f(x)→Lx < a, f(x) \to Lx<a,f(x)→L
  • Right-sided limit: lim⁡x→a+f(x)=L\lim_{x \to a^+} f(x) = Llimx→a+​f(x)=L
    • means xxx approaches aaa with x>a,f(x)→Lx > a, f(x) \to Lx>a,f(x)→L

Examples:

lim⁡x→2−x2=4\lim_{x \to 2^-} x^2 = 4 x→2−lim​x2=4

lim⁡x→2+x2=4\lim_{x \to 2^+} x^2 = 4 x→2+lim​x2=4

lim⁡x→0+1x=∞\lim_{x \to 0^+} \frac{1}{x} = \infty x→0+lim​x1​=∞

lim⁡x→0−1x=−∞\lim_{x \to 0^-} \frac{1}{x} = -\infty x→0−lim​x1​=−∞

lim⁡x→0+∣x∣x=lim⁡x→0+xx=1\lim_{x \to 0^+} \frac{|x|}{x} = \lim_{x \to 0^+} \frac{x}{x} = 1 x→0+lim​x∣x∣​=x→0+lim​xx​=1

lim⁡x→0−∣x∣x=lim⁡x→0−−xx=−1\lim_{x \to 0^-} \frac{|x|}{x} = \lim_{x \to 0^-} \frac{-x}{x} = -1 x→0−lim​x∣x∣​=x→0−lim​x−x​=−1

Existence of limits

A limit exists if and only if the left-sided limit and the right-sided limit are equal.

lim⁡x→af(x)=L  ⟺  lim⁡x→a−f(x)=lim⁡x→a+f(x)=L\lim_{x \to a} f(x) = L \iff \lim_{x \to a^-} f(x) = \lim_{x \to a^+} f(x) = L x→alim​f(x)=L⟺x→a−lim​f(x)=x→a+lim​f(x)=L

Types of non-existence

  • Jump discontinuity: lim⁡x→a−f(x)≠lim⁡x→a+f(x)\lim_{x \to a^-} f(x) \neq \lim_{x \to a^+} f(x)limx→a−​f(x)=limx→a+​f(x).
  • Infinite discontinuity: lim⁡x→a+f(x)=∞\lim_{x \to a^+} f(x) = \inftylimx→a+​f(x)=∞ and lim⁡x→a−f(x)=−∞\lim_{x \to a^-} f(x) = -\inftylimx→a−​f(x)=−∞ for example.

Examples:

lim⁡x→0∣x∣x does not exist because lim⁡x→0+∣x∣x=1≠lim⁡x→0−∣x∣x=−1\lim_{x \to 0} \frac{|x|}{x} \text{ does not exist because } \lim_{x \to 0^+} \frac{|x|}{x} = 1 \neq \lim_{x \to 0^-} \frac{|x|}{x} = -1 x→0lim​x∣x∣​ does not exist because x→0+lim​x∣x∣​=1=x→0−lim​x∣x∣​=−1

lim⁡x→01x does not exist because lim⁡x→0+1x=∞≠lim⁡x→0−1x=−∞\lim_{x \to 0} \frac{1}{x} \text{ does not exist because } \lim_{x \to 0^+} \frac{1}{x} = \infty \neq \lim_{x \to 0^-} \frac{1}{x} = -\infty x→0lim​x1​ does not exist because x→0+lim​x1​=∞=x→0−lim​x1​=−∞

Example

f(x)={x2+1if x≤0x+1if x>0f(x) = \begin{cases} x^2 + 1 & \text{if } x \leq 0 \\ x + 1 & \text{if } x > 0 \end{cases}f(x)={x2+1x+1​if x≤0if x>0​

lim⁡x→0−f(x)=lim⁡x→0−(x2+1)=1\lim_{x \to 0^-} f(x) = \lim_{x \to 0^-} (x^2 + 1) = 1 x→0−lim​f(x)=x→0−lim​(x2+1)=1

lim⁡x→0+f(x)=lim⁡x→0+(x+1)=1\lim_{x \to 0^+} f(x) = \lim_{x \to 0^+} (x + 1) = 1 x→0+lim​f(x)=x→0+lim​(x+1)=1

lim⁡x→0f(x)=1\lim_{x \to 0} f(x) = 1 x→0lim​f(x)=1

Infinity limits

Vertical Asymptotes

If f(x)f(x)f(x) grows without bound as xxx approaches aaa, we write

lim⁡x→af(x)=∞\lim_{x \to a} f(x) = \infty x→alim​f(x)=∞

or

lim⁡x→af(x)=−∞\lim_{x \to a} f(x) = -\infty x→alim​f(x)=−∞

This signals a vertical asymptote at x=ax = ax=a.

Example:

h(x)=1(x−3)2h(x) = \frac{1}{(x-3)^2} h(x)=(x−3)21​

As x→3x \to 3x→3, denominator →0\to 0→0, numerator positive →\to→

lim⁡x→3h(x)=∞\lim_{x \to 3} h(x) = \infty x→3lim​h(x)=∞

One-sided blow-up

p(x)=1x−1p(x) = \frac{1}{x-1} p(x)=x−11​

One‐sided blow‐up:

lim⁡x→1−p(x)=−∞\lim_{x \to 1^-} p(x) = -\infty x→1−lim​p(x)=−∞

lim⁡x→1+p(x)=∞\lim_{x \to 1^+} p(x) = \infty x→1+lim​p(x)=∞

Horizontal Asymptotes

Describing end‐behavior:

lim⁡x→∞f(x)=L\lim_{x \to \infty} f(x) = L x→∞lim​f(x)=L

lim⁡x→∞f(x)=L  ⟹  y=L is a horizontal asymptote on the right\lim_{x \to \infty} f(x) = L \implies y = L \text{ is a horizontal asymptote on the right} x→∞lim​f(x)=L⟹y=L is a horizontal asymptote on the right

Similarly for lim⁡x→−∞f(x)=L\lim_{x \to -\infty} f(x) = Llimx→−∞​f(x)=L.

Examples:

lim⁡x→∞2x2+35x2−1=25\lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{2x^2 + 3}{5x^2 - 1} = \frac{2}{5} x→∞lim​5x2−12x2+3​=52​

lim⁡x→−∞2x2+35x2−1=25\lim_{x \to -\infty} \frac{2x^2 + 3}{5x^2 - 1} = \frac{2}{5} x→−∞lim​5x2−12x2+3​=52​

Example 2:

lim⁡x→∞2−x=0\lim_{x \to \infty} 2^{-x} = 0 x→∞lim​2−x=0

Example 3:

lim⁡x→−∞2−x=∞\lim_{x \to -\infty} 2^{-x} = \infty x→−∞lim​2−x=∞

Exercises

0. Feedback

Please fill this feedback form on week 3: Feedback form

1. Check your understanding

Write 98765 if the limit is ∞\infty∞ and -98765 if the limit is −∞-\infty−∞.

a) What is lim⁡x→3+(2x+7)\lim_{x \to 3^+} (2x + 7)limx→3+​(2x+7)?





b) What is lim⁡x→3−(2x+7)\lim_{x \to 3^-} (2x + 7)limx→3−​(2x+7)?





c) What is lim⁡x→−1∣x∣x\lim_{x \to -1} \frac{|x|}{x}limx→−1​x∣x∣​?





d) What is lim⁡x→3+1x−3\lim_{x \to 3^+} \frac{1}{x-3}limx→3+​x−31​?





e) What is lim⁡x→3−1x−3\lim_{x \to 3^-} \frac{1}{x-3}limx→3−​x−31​?





f) What is lim⁡x→3x2−9x−3\lim_{x \to 3} \frac{x^2 - 9}{x - 3}limx→3​x−3x2−9​?





g) What is lim⁡x→−1+1x2−1\lim_{x \to -1^+} \frac{1}{x^2 - 1}limx→−1+​x2−11​?





h) What is lim⁡x→1−x2−1x−1\lim_{x \to 1^-} \frac{x^2 - 1}{x-1}limx→1−​x−1x2−1​?





i) What is lim⁡x→1+x2−1x−1\lim_{x \to 1^+} \frac{x^2 - 1}{x-1}limx→1+​x−1x2−1​?





2. Evaluate the limit using graphs

Use graphs (Desmos or GeoGebra) to estimate the following limits.

Write 98765 if the limit is ∞\infty∞ and -98765 if the limit is −∞-\infty−∞.

a) lim⁡x→2+log⁡(x)x−2\lim_{x \to 2^+} \frac{\log (x)}{x-2}limx→2+​x−2log(x)​.





b) lim⁡x→1log⁡(x)x−1\lim_{x \to 1} \frac{\log (x)}{x-1}limx→1​x−1log(x)​. (Round to 2 decimal places)





c) lim⁡x→∞4x5−3x2+1\lim_{x \to \infty} 4x^5-3x^2+1limx→∞​4x5−3x2+1.





d) lim⁡x→−∞4x5−3x2+1\lim_{x \to -\infty} 4x^5-3x^2+1limx→−∞​4x5−3x2+1.





e) lim⁡x→∞x−x\lim_{x \to \infty} \sqrt{x} - xlimx→∞​x​−x.





f) lim⁡x→∞4+9x2x+1\lim_{x \to \infty} \frac{\sqrt{4+9x^2}}{x+1}limx→∞​x+14+9x2​​.
